results.title: Newsfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures

results.title: [New Zealand Weekly Review. No. 201]
results.brief_description: Newreel items include: 1. UNRRA. Clothes for Europe, loading stores for refugees in Europe. 2. Hastings - Spring show. 3. Temuka - Bailey Bridge in Civvies. Wartime Bailey Bridge erected to help country area. 4. From war to peace - returned servicemen train for the building industry. 5. McKenzie Country - down from the tops.

results.title: Looking for Alibrandi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Robyn Kershaw, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Premium Movie Partnership and AFFC
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by first time writer Melina Marchetta, “Looking for Alibrandi” is an affectionate look at three generations of strong willed Italian women, and the youngest member, Josie’s (Pia Miranda) attempt to break the family “curse”. 17 year old Josie lives with her single mother Christina (Greta Scacchi), is completing her HSC at an exclusive Sydney school on a scholarship, begrudgingly visiting her Nonna, defending the labels of “wog” and “bastard”, and longing after the lifestyle afforded to rich kids with both parents. When her father, Michael (Anthony La Paglia) enters their lives again, Josie confronts her mother and her Nonna about the rift between Christina and her father, and the animosity between mother and daughter to reveal secrets long since hidden. Josie must also make decisions about her future career and what her heart desires as she is torn between school captain John Barton (Matthew Newton) and public school boy Jacob (Kick Gurry). Between work, school, family and personal relationships, Josie discovers that life is filled with uncertainty and she is not the only one debilitated by the labels society ascribes. This was the first feature film effort for both director Woods and actor Miranda. Remarkably, the film was nominated and won several AFI awards, including best film, best supporting actress (Scacchi) and best performance by an actress in a leading role (Miranda).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Woods, Robyn Kershaw, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Premium Movie Partnership and AFFC

results.title: Two hands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gregor Jordan, Marian MacGowan, Meridian Films and CML
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.

results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: Ken G. Hall and National Films Council
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.
